Contact Us & Directions
Our office staff is available Monday through Friday from 9:00 a.m. until 5:00 p.m. to answer general questions about Foxfire. If you have questions regarding golf or dining, please contact the Pro Shop or Restaurant. Guests must enter Foxfire from the Davis Boulevard gate. A transponder is required for entry through the Radio Road gate.
All sales of homes in Foxfire are handled privately or though real-estate agents. The Foxfire Community Association does not handle home sales, but does ensure that new owners receive information regarding their homeownership in the community. Questions about quarterly fees or the “new owner packet” may be directed to the Association office at (239) 643-3139.

Meet Club Management
Administration
Name
Donald Shea
Title
General Manager
Phone
239-643-3139
Donald began his career at Foxfire in August 1997 as First Assistant Golf Professional. He was promoted to Head Golf Professional in October 2000 and named Director of Golf six years later. In December 2012, Donald was promoted to General Manager, responsible for all operations at Foxfire.
Donald has excelled as a teacher and manager. He received the “Junior Golf Leader” award from the Southwest Florida Chapter PGA in both 2004 and 2006. In 2008, Donald was recognized as the Southwest Florida Chapter PGA “Golf Professional of the Year.” He is a PGA Class A Member and holds a B.S. in Education. His home state is Massachusetts.
Add to Contact
Name
Victoria Gabriel
Title
Controller
Phone
239-643-3139 x203
Victoria completed four years at Pyatigorsk State Linguistic University, where she studied public/municipal administration and management. Victoria also attended Texas Christian University in Fort Worth and graduated Summa Cum Laude with her Bachelor’s and Master’s degrees in Business Administration and Accounting. Victoria is a licensed CPA in Florida.
Prior to joining Foxfire in 2021, Victoria served as Director of Accounting for Moorings Park Communities. Victoria also worked for a national public accounting firm where she performed audits for companies in a variety of industries.
Add to Contact
Name
Josie Schaa
Title
Communications Coordinator
Phone
239-643-3139  x208
My name is Josie Schaa. I graduated Cum Laude from the University of Alabama in May 2024 with a bachelor's degree in Communication and Information Sciences. Having lived in Naples my whole life, I have a deep appreciation for the beauty of Florida, especially spending time on the water in the Keys with family and friends.

Creativity is at the heart of everything I do—I love bringing fresh ideas to the table and finding new ways to express innovation. I’m excited about the opportunities for growth and collaboration at Foxfire and look forward to making a meaningful impact. I look forward to working with you all and bringing new ideas to Foxfire.
Add to Contact
Food & Beverage
Name
Vanessa Bowman
Title
Food & Beverage Director
Phone
239-643-2977
My career in hospitality started at the age of 16 as a server at a popular authentic South African restaurant in my hometown. After High School, I joined the International Hotel School in South Africa and earned my Diplomas in Hospitality Management, Food and Beverage Management and Kitchen Management.
I came to America in 2009 and worked as an intern in the culinary department at the Ritz Carlton Beach Resort in Naples. I worked as a cook for 5 years at the Ritz Carlton Tiburon.
My career took off after working for Chef Ryan at Fiddle sticks Country Club as a Sous Chef. I became Executive Chef at a private community in Estero, 2 years after joining Fiddle Sticks. Then I moved up and on to be Dining Service Director / Executive Chef / General Manager.

Add to Contact
Name
Elmo Bida
Title
Executive Chef
Phone
239-643-2977	 x219
My culinary journey began while studying industrial engineering, where I discovered a passion for cooking. Within three months, I left engineering to pursue culinary arts, winning a "Promising Chef" award in my first year. This inspired me to study international cuisine and move to the U.S., where I worked as a sous chef and chef de cuisine at renowned Florida clubs.
I later opened my own restaurant in Naples, earning recognition as one of Carla Hall's Top 10 Favorite Chefs in Southwest Florida. With over 11 years in the industry, I continually seek to expand my skills and innovate in the global culinary scene
Add to Contact
Golf
Name
Stephen Richardson
Title
Head Golf Professional
Phone
239-643-2402
Stephen joined Foxfire in November 2000 as Second Assistant Golf Professional. He was promoted to First Assistant Golf Professional in 2003 and three years later was promoted to his current position as Head Golf Professional. Stephen manages the day-to-day operations of the Pro Shop and Cart Barn, oversees clerical functions and ensures efficient utilization of the golf course as specified by the General Manager.
Stephen has been a PGA Class A Member since April 2000. He is originally from Brooklyn, New York and has been a Naples resident since 1991.
Add to Contact
Name
Dylan Guehlstorf
Title
First Assistant Golf Professional
Phone
239-642-2402
Dylan was born in Franklin, WI. Dylan started playing golf at a young age and competed
on his high school golf team in Greendale, WI. He attended the Golf Academy of
America in 2017 and is a Level 2 Associate of the PGA Professional Golf Management
Program working toward being a Class A Professional. He started working in the
industry in 2018 at the Country Club at Deer Run. In 2019, he returned home to
Wisconsin and worked at Buttes des Morts Country Club as the Second Assistant. He
has been at Foxfire for 5 years now and is the First Assistant Golf Professional.

Add to Contact
Golf Course Maintenance
Name
Beau Baker
Title
Golf Course Superintendent
Phone
239-643-1055
Hello, my name is Beau Baker, and I’m excited to be joining Foxfire Country Club as your new Golf Course Superintendent. I moved to Naples a little over four years ago and have truly enjoyed everything this beautiful area has to offer. Prior to joining Foxfire, I was part of the team at Grey Oaks Country Club, where we successfully elevated the club to a level of excellence. Before that, I worked in Key Largo at Ocean Reef Club, where my passion for the industry really began to take off. Outside of work, my girlfriend and I love to explore new foods and travel to exciting destinations. One of our most memorable trips was to her family’s homeland in Northern Italy, where we immersed ourselves in the culture and cuisine. I’m looking forward to making a positive impact at Foxfire and enhancing the member experience, both on and off the golf course, to create something truly special for all of you.
Add to Contact
Name
Gavin Hess
Title
Common Grounds Supervisor
Phone
239-643-1055
Gavin joined Foxfire as an equipment operator in 2008 and was promoted to Assistant Superintendent in 2013.
Gavin is originally from Upstate New York and is a graduate of Susquehanna University in Pennsylvania with a B.A. in Communications. He began his golf career at Naples Grande Beach Resort in 2006. Before moving to Florida, Gavin lived on a family-owned tree farm for 14 years where his love for agriculture blossomed.

Tennis
Name
Greg Gadoua
Title
Tennis Instructor
Phone
239-564-1277
Greg has been running tennis drills and giving private lessons at Foxfire for more than 10 years. He has been teaching tennis for over 30 years and is a USPTA P1 professional. Additionally, Greg provides racket-stringing service to Foxfire members.

Membership
We are a private golf-course community of 931 condominiums, verandas, villas and single-family houses. Membership in Foxfire is automatic with the purchase of a home in the community and includes access to all of our amenities.  There is no initiation or membership fee for joining the club.
The Foxfire Community Association, Inc. is charged with maintaining the common areas of Foxfire and acquires the necessary funding through quarterly billings to homeowners. All home sales in Foxfire are handled privately or though real-estate agents. The Foxfire Community Association does not handle home sales but does ensure that new owners receive information regarding their homeownership in the community. Questions about quarterly fees or the “new owner packet” may be directed to the Association office at (239) 643-3139.
Community Facts
Twenty-seven holes of golf designed by Arthur Hills and available for member play throughout the year.
Just ten minutes from the Gulf beaches, downtown Naples and shopping centers.
Men’s and women’s 18- and 9-hole golf leagues.
19 homeowners’ associations with most offering a swimming pool and tennis courts.
Clubhouse restaurants offering a variety of dining options: Main Dining Room, Foxlair Grille & Lounge and Halfway House.
Clubhouse amenities appealing to all lifestyles, including tennis courts, swimming pool, library, fitness room and wireless Internet service.
Many social activities – Bocce, Book Discussion Group, Bridge, Mah Jongg, and Trivia, to name a few.
The community map to the right will orient you to the location of streets, golf courses and associations within Foxfire.
